intro: Pometia pinnata f. cuspidata, commonly known as the pointed-leaf pometia, is a botanical variant characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The leaves are typically lanceolate with acuminate tips, giving it the "cuspidata" designation. This plant often grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its botanical features make it of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
